moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. d4 exd: transposing into a scotch.  5 Nd5 is the Belgrade Gambit
moves.8. exd5 cxd5 9. Qe2+ Be6 10. Bb5+: a check which gives white the edge.
moves.10... Nd7 11. O-O: 11 Bc6 directly allows white to steal the "d" pawn
moves.12... Rb8 13. Nxd5 Bd6: black has nothing and must strive for some sort of counterplay
moves.20. Bxa7 Ne5 21. Re1 Ng4+: this is a careless transposition.  21 ... Qh6+ first was right leading to a win of the exchange as in the game.
moves.22. Kg1: considerable work was done here to try to find a winning line against 22 Kg3.  the best I came up with was 22 ... Qh6 23 Rxe8+ Rxe8 24 Qh1 Qd6+ 25 f4 Bxd3! 26 cxd3 Qxd3+! 27 Kxg4 f5+ 28 Kh4 Re6! with good winning chances.
moves.22... Qh6 23. f3 Qh2+ 24. Kf1 Qh1+ 25. B: this allows a smashing combination.  27 Kf2! offered the most resistance in a tricky position since white has a passed "a" pawn which could be formidable if the queens came off the board
moves.27... Rexd3: winning the queen, mating or coming out a rook ahead.
